column4: Is there a trick so links run by default instead of asking for one of those 4 options?
irssi will start with no options
How does that solve my problme?
but there's prolly a .links file that you can store defaults
Where?
Ubuntu keeps a .links file for default configuration of links?
most user apps do have a similar file i would just assume
i found a user's manual http://links.sourceforge.net/docs/manual-0.82-en/
I'll give it a check

Oh lawd.. Hehe.. Not links the application for text-based web browsing.. Just links.. As in make a link to an executable file and make it Run by default (I want to avoid that pop-up question: [Run in terminal] [Edit] [Cancel] [Run])
is the file executable?
Yes.. I've never known when Ubuntu asks for the action...
how are you running it? by clicking on it?
Made the executable file, and made a link, normal procedure. Double clicking pops up the question
did you make a launcher on the desktop? and that's what your clicking?
Yeap
you made a link with ln -s ?
No, graphically interfacing
with a path directly to the exectuable?
Yes..
i can't reproduce the problem, i don't get that pop up box.. tho i have heard of this in this channel before
No problemo. It won't kill me. Ty
